numbers.description: Understanding integers, rational numbers, real numbers, and their properties.

fractions.description: Representation and operations with rational numbers expressed as ratios of integers.

decimals.description: Representation of numbers using base-10 positional notation with fractional parts.

percentages.description: Expressing numbers as parts per hundred and solving percentage problems.

variables.description: Use of symbols to represent unknown or changing quantities.

constants.description: Fixed values that do not change.

addition.description: Combining two or more numbers to find their sum or total.

subtraction.description: Finding the difference between numbers by removing one quantity from another.

multiplication.description: Repeated addition of a number to itself a specified number of times to find a product.

division.description: Splitting a number into equal parts or determining how many times one number contains another.

arithmetic.description: Fundamental operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

order-of-operations.description: Rules for evaluating mathematical expressions with multiple operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS).

exponents.description: Representation of repeated multiplication using powers and understanding exponential notation.

roots.description: Finding values that when raised to a power produce a given number, including square and nth roots.

expressions.description: Mathematical phrases combining numbers, variables, and operations without an equality sign.

equations.description: Mathematical statements asserting equality between two expressions and methods for solving them.

inequalities.description: Mathematical statements comparing expressions using greater than, less than, or related symbols.

linear-equations.description: Equations of the first degree with one or more variables forming straight lines when graphed.

quadratic-equations.description: Second-degree polynomial equations and methods for solving them including factoring.

polynomials.description: Expressions with variables and coefficients using addition, subtraction, and multiplication.

factoring.description: Breaking down polynomials and numbers into products of simpler factors.

functions.description: Relationships between inputs and outputs where each input corresponds to exactly one output.

algebra.description: Using symbols and variables to solve equations and understand structures.

ratios.description: Comparison of two quantities showing the relative size of one quantity to another.

proportions.description: Equations stating that two ratios are equal and methods for solving proportion problems.

coordinate-plane.description: Two-dimensional plane formed by perpendicular number lines for graphing points and relations.

graphing.description: Visual representation of equations, functions, and data on coordinate systems.

slope.description: Measure of the steepness of a line representing rate of change.

geometry-basics.description: Fundamental concepts of shapes, sizes, positions, and properties of space and geometric figures.

area-perimeter.description: Calculating the distance around shapes (perimeter) and the space enclosed within shapes (area).

volume-surface-area.description: Calculating three-dimensional space occupied by objects and the total area of their surfaces.

pythagorean-theorem.description: In right triangles, the hypotenuse squared equals the sum of squares of the other two sides.

trigonometry-basics.description: Study of relationships between angles and sides of triangles using sine, cosine, and tangent.

statistics-basics.description: Collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data using mean, median, mode, and range.

probability.description: Mathematical study of likelihood and chance, quantifying the likelihood of events occurring.
